name: Super 8 Santa Fe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband and we found this to be great value.
reviews.title: Very good value for the price

reviews.text: Its not the Hilton, and the room was a little on the small size, but for the price we paid we were very happy with it. The bedroom and bathroom were very clean and the shower was very good. There was a good iron and hairdryer, and wireless internet. The self service breakfast in the lobby was reasonable.
reviews.title: Exactly what we expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was about a 10 minute drive into Santa Fe so we were quite happy with the location, although if you didn't have a car and wanted to explore Santa Fe you'd be better off staying closer into downtown.
reviews.title: Clean,Good Rates.
Good location, service and value for money
reviews.text: Overall this was great value for money and I would definitely stay here again

The place is not the most glamorous, newest, or whatever, but it’s clean, affordable, quiet, in good location. The room is good size (we had king bed) with recliner; the bathroom on the other hand is tiny. TV channel selection is good as well (over 70 channels). The breakfast is below average, but you can survive on it for couple of days. The staff was friendly and helpful. They have Wi-Fi in the room or if you do not have your own laptop, there is a PC in the lobby. Plenty of restaurants / shopping nearby, you can even walk to the mall if you wish.
reviews.title: fair deal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Basic hotel, but quite a good deal. Room was clean enough, front desk people were nice, pretty good breakfast for a Super 8, and the wifi worked. What else can you need?
reviews.title: Good deal

reviews.text: For a hotel so affordable I couldn't imagine it would be SO GOOD !!
reviews.title: Amazing for the price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very comfortable, remodeled rooms, very clean and much more...
reviews.title: Bad Service and Ammenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived aprox 1:20am, in the rain.There was no one in the front desk and we could not get in. I pushed the bell and called on the telephone for over 5 minutes before someone finally shows up.
reviews.title: Be careful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was generally clean, the shower was very creaky. One pillow had blood stains on it. Gross! And there was a coffee pot in the room, however there was no coffee.
reviews.title: Good price for Santa Fe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff, nice and clean room, all the facilities you need, excellent breakfast
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night. We were a little skeptical after seeing the review about the stabbing, so we were pleasantly surprised that it was located in a decent area, on a main road surrounded by big box stores and chain restaurants. We chose this hotel because it was reasonably priced, unlike most of the other lodging in Santa Fe.
reviews.title: Big safe, little towels

reviews.text: It was about a 5 minute drive to the downtown area. The room itself was pretty basic and forgettable. There was nothing that stood out in either a good way or a bad way, except for the scant allotment of towels. A single tiny washcloth hung where hand towels should have been. But if you are in need of a massive safe during your stay--you're in luck! The room had the largest hotel safe I've ever seen. I think their money would have been better spent on some real towels.
reviews.title: Good Price, but Could Use Some TLC

reviews.text: Don't count on much for the free breakfast. There wasn't much available, and it was quite busy.
reviews.title: so so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this place was fine for a stay totaling 12 hours, especially since the price was good, but I wouldn't really want to stay here for an extended period.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever!

reviews.text: When I first arrived I thought this would be a great place. The building and lobby looked very nice. Also, the room was nice and roomy.
reviews.title: Poorly Managed - nothing worked

reviews.text: But then I noticed that instead of a smoke detector on the ceiling, there were just two bare wires hanging down. Looks like it had a problem, and nobody bothered to replace it.
reviews.title: Nothing here worked... AVOID.
Good For The Money
reviews.text: Also this is the only Super 8 room that I have stayed in that didn't have a refrigerator.
This motel is very large there must be at least 200 rooms, but only one ice machine. As a result, the ice machine was always out of ice - no matter what time of day I tried it.
reviews.title: Cheap dump at $49; good breakfast though

reviews.text: There was a public computer in lobby, but it had an "out of order" sign on it all three days I stayed there.
reviews.title: Satisfactory

aka: Super 8 Santa Fe Hotel Santa Fe
description: This hotel in Santa Fe offers free Wi-Fi, a deluxe continental breakfast with biscuits & gravy and hot waffles. The downtown Plaza and St Francis Cathedral are a 15-minute drive away.Rooms at the Super 8 Santa Fe include a coffee maker, hair dryer, iron and ironing board, Satellite TV with SHOWTIME and free safes for guests. Select rooms offer a lounge chair and table. Mini Suites offer a pull out couch.24-hout front desk and free on-site parking with security patrol at night as well as CCTV security cameras monitoring the property. Laundry facilities and a fitness center are also available.The Santa Fe Convention Center and Georgia O'Keeffe Museum are both within a 15-minute drive of this Super 8 hotel. The New Mexico State Capitol is 10 minutes away by car.
